Package renderer

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
renderer.Camera
public class Camera extends Object
Camera class will serve as the ability to catch a scene by sending multiple rays through a view plane to the objects
Author:
Mendy Welner 209272228. mendiwell@gmail.com Mendy Segal. 211769955.Mendysegal490@gmail.com

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera(Point p, Vector vTo, Vector vUp)
      Constructor to create a new camera object with the specified vector directions and a starting point
      Parameters:
      p - point starting point of camera
      vTo - vector direction to the center of view plane
      vUp - vector the up direction of the camera

    • constructRay

      public Ray constructRay(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      This function returns ray through a pixel in view plane
      Parameters:
      nX - -number of rows in view plane
      nY - -number of columns in view plane
      j - -pixel number of columns
      i - -pixel number of rows
      Returns:
      a ray passing through a cretin pixel in view plane

    • renderImage

      public Camera renderImage()
      This function creates the image of the scene using the imageWriter class
      Returns:
      this camera

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid(int interval, Color color)
      This function prints the grid of image after drawing it by a color
      Parameters:
      interval - -amount of pixel skipping before painting on grid
      color - -the color we paint on the grid

    • writeToImage

      public void writeToImage()
      This function delegating to writeToImage function that produce png file of the image

    • castRay

      private Color castRay(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      This function helps us to calculate the color of pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - -rows of view plane
      nY - -columns of view plane
      j - -rows indexer
      i - -columns indexer
      Returns:
      color of a point in the pixel grid
